discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Band steering helps clients connect to the fastest available network by encouraging capable devices to use the 5GHz band instead of the 2.4GHz band. All other options would be counter to the requirement of the fastest possible way

questions.question_text: A network engineer is completing a wireless installation in a new building. A requirement is that all clients be able to automatically connect to the fastest supported network. Which of the following best supports this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
EOL marks the point in a product's lifecycle when the manufacturer stops selling and marketing the product, and begins scaling back support. EOL can lead to the eventual end of support from the manufacturer. So the technician should plan to decommission once EOL becomes EOS.

Selected Answer: C
Wouldn't you want to upgrade? Decommissioned mean your just getting rid of it but then that service is gone right? If you upgrade to a new system that is supported then you have a system that is current and the network remains operational. Just a thought

Selected Answer: B
EOL means the device is no longer supported by the manufacturer, meaning no more updates, patches, or technical support. When a device reaches EOL, it should be decommissioned to maintain security, reliability, and supportability in the network

questions.question_text: A network technician notices a device is at EOL. For which of the following should the technician plan?

A company implements a video streaming solution that will play on all computers that have joined a particular group, but router ACLs are blocking the traffic. Which of the following is the most appropriate IP address that will be allowed in the ACL?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
224.0.0.1 is a multicast IP address within the range 224.0.0.0â€“239.255.255.255, reserved for multicast traffic. Specifically, 224.0.0.1 is the "all hosts" multicast address, meaning it targets all devices on the local network segment that are configured to listen to multicast traffic. This aligns well with a video streaming solution for a group of computers, as multicast is commonly used for such purposes

choices.B: Performing regular scanning of unauthorized devices
choices.F: Ensuring least privilege concepts are in place
choices.D: Enabling logical security such as SSO

questions.question_text: Which of the following are the best device-hardening techniques for network security? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Direct device-hardening techniques (modifying the device itself): A (disabling unused ports), E (changing default passwords), stand out.

Network-wide or monitoring practices: B (scanning) and C (log monitoring) are more about ongoing security management, not hardening the device. D (SSO) is about authentication, not device configuration F (least privilege on the device) may be a good choice too but. The best device-hardening techniques from the list are A and E, as they are universally recognized, directly applicable to securing the device, and foundational to reducing vulnerabilities.

questions.question_text: Which of the following allows for the interception of traffic between the source and destination?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
An on-path attack refers to a scenario where an attacker positions themselves between two communicating devices (like a computer and a server) and intercepts or modifies the data being exchanged. This allows them to eavesdrop on the communication, potentially stealing sensitive information or injecting malicious code
